doc.snippet: AC7 Landing Page defines the comprehensive requirements for the landing page including hero section, "Como funciona" with 4 steps, disclaimer section, responsive design, and SEO optimization. This is the authoritative source for acceptance criteria and technical constraints.

doc.title: Tech Spec Epic 1
doc.snippet: Workflow defines the step-by-step implementation process for Story 1.8, including creating layout components (AppHeader, Footer), landing sections (Hero, HowItWorks, Disclaimer), integration, SEO optimization, responsive testing, accessibility audit, and production deployment verification.

doc.title: Epics Detailed
doc.section: Epic 1, Story 1.8 - Create Landing Page Layout
doc.snippet: Story 1.8 establishes the landing page as the first contact point with potential users. Requirements include professional presentation with hero section, "Como funciona" with 4 steps, honest disclaimer about Wheeling Systems limitations, AppHeader with gradient logo, Footer with legal links, responsive design (mobile-first), and SSR for SEO.

doc.title: UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Emerald Trust (#10b981) is the chosen color theme for Sorte Grande, communicating trust, growth, and intelligent decisions. The theme combines fintech reliability with controlled optimism. Primary color #10b981 (emerald green) gradients to #34d399, on dark background (#0a0a0a) for sophistication and reduced eye strain.

doc.title: UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Landing page design emphasizes "Trust-Based Generation" pattern - system decides everything, user trusts the methodology. Hero section has title "Apostas inteligentes baseadas em matemática", gradient CTA button with shadow, "Como funciona" with 4 numbered steps (32x32px circles), and honest disclaimer in red warning box.

doc.title: UX Design Directions HTML
doc.snippet: Complete visual mockup of the landing page showing gradient logo, hero section with centered title and CTA button, "Como funciona" section with 4 numbered steps in grid layout, disclaimer warning box with red border, and footer with legal links. This is the definitive visual reference.

doc.title: Architecture Document
doc.snippet: Next.js 16 App Router with Server Components by default for SEO optimization. Project structure defines components/layout/ for reusable layout components (AppHeader, Footer), components/landing/ for landing-specific sections, and app/page.tsx as the landing page route. Server Components should be used unless client interactivity is required.

doc.title: Architecture Document
doc.snippet: shadcn/ui is the chosen component library, providing accessible components based on Radix UI. Button, Input, Card, Badge, Toast, Dialog components are available. Components are customizable with Tailwind CSS and follow WCAG 2.1 Level A accessibility standards by default.

constraints.constraint: Server Components by default - do not add 'use client' directive unless client interactivity required. Landing page should be SSR for SEO optimization.
Semantic HTML required - use <header>, <main>, <section>, <footer> tags for accessibility and SEO.
Max-width container (1200px or 1400px) to prevent edge-to-edge layout on large screens.
Mobile-first responsive design - base styles target <768px, use md: for tablet, lg: for desktop.
Tailwind 4.0 limitation - CSS variables don't work in className. Use inline styles for gradients: style={{ background: 'linear-gradient(135deg, #10b981 0%, #34d399 100%)' }}

Gradient text (logo) requires WebkitBackgroundClip and WebkitTextFillColor: style={{ background: 'linear-gradient(...)', WebkitBackgroundClip: 'text', WebkitTextFillColor: 'transparent', backgroundClip: 'text' }}
CTA button shadow must use inline boxShadow: boxShadow: '0 4px 12px rgba(16,185,129,0.3)'
Next.js metadata export must be in Server Component (page.tsx). Use: export const metadata: Metadata = { title: '...', description: '...', keywords: '...' }
Manual testing required - Lighthouse Performance > 90, Accessibility > 90, Best Practices > 90, SEO > 90.
Responsive testing required - Chrome DevTools device toolbar for mobile (375px), tablet (768px), desktop (1440px).
Production deployment automatic on push to main branch. Verify at https://sorte-grande-ten.vercel.app after merge.
